testimony: May I then call Dumisa Mdlulwa, Judge, to come over?
Mr Mdlulwa, what language would you prefer to use?
What language, I didn't get the answer?
The witness is going to be testifying in Xhosa.
Mr Mdlulwa, could you give us your full names and where you reside?
My name is Dumisa Mdlulwa, I reside at Zimbane.
During the time of this incident, were you a member of any organisation, that is the incident of the shoot-out at the school?
Yes, I was a member of the African National Congress.
Were you a member of MK as well?
Is it correct that you were part of the Security section of the ANC at that time, of the incident?
And were you one with Mr Matshaya that was deployed to Port St Johns on that day?
Did you listen to Mr Mashaya's evidence as to what happened there that day?
Do you agree with that or don't you?
Yes, I agree with his testimony.
Is there anything that you would like to change?
No, there is nothing I would like to change, except for the fact that there is a minor detail that he has left out.
I was going to ask you, if there is anything that you wish to add.

The cars that were there, our car was at the back and the other car was, the car that was in the front, it was shot at and that is actually the proof that they were shooting at the direction of the school.  The driver was inside, but inside the car he was not hit and he tried to reverse and he left and his shoe was left inside the car, and we tried to get some spades to take our car, to try to remove our car, and we left the scene.  That is what I wanted to add.
No, there is nothing else.  He mentioned everything.
Were you carrying any firearms, yourself personally?
Amongst the - did you notice anyone else other than the ones that Mr Matshaya has mentioned, as having participated in this shoot-out from your side?

There was a lot of confusion, full of people, I cannot remember who else was there.   During this shoot-out there was a pandemonium, the others were crying on the other side as we were also returning fire, we also had to save them, try to remove them and try to calm them down.
From your own firing, did you see anyone amongst the people who were struck by a bullet from your firearm?

No, I do not remember seeing anyone, because the area was bushy and people would see only shadows because even if you would try to peep through and you would hear a bullet hitting nearby and you would try and take cover.
Did you have a license in respect of this firearm that you were using?
Yes, we got the licences - we got the firearms from the Commander, I did not have my own license for the firearm.
You have already indicated that you confirm what has been stated by Mr Matshaya regarding the incident?

That is all Chairperson.
NO FURTHER QUESTIONS BY MR MGIDLANA
If my memory serves me correctly, I think it was around March, but I cannot remember the date.

Thank you Judge, no questions for this witness.
NO CROSS-EXAMINATION BY MR MALUSI

No questions, Judge.
NO CROSS-EXAMINATION BY MR MGXAJI

Just one Chairperson.  Mr Mdlulwa, in your application, I just want you to clarify this point, on page 52 of the paginated pages, you say on paragraph 9(b) where the question is "state whether any person was injured", you say "yes, TDF soldiers and some people killed by the bandits", what do you mean by that?
Will you please repeat your question, sir?
In your application form there some part where you say that TDF soldier was killed and you say and some "people killed by the bandits".
You want to know more about the bandits?

I think that is the language used by the person who was helping me writing this statement, because I never mentioned that term, bandits.  Poswa, the person who was helping me writing the statement, may have used his own language.

I see.  Thank you, no further questions, Mr Chair.
NO FURTHER QUESTIONS BY MR MAPOMA
Mr Mgidlana, I don't suppose you have any re-examination?

There is none Judge, thank you.
NO RE-EXAMINATION BY MR MGIDLANA

Thank you, you are excused.
WITNESS EXCUSED
